poem:
Radical Petunias

In South Central's fertile plot,  
a rebellion blooms quietly—  
carrots and petunias defy bylaws,  
wrapping their roots around  
the stubborn bones of asphalt.  
Here, queer hands till the soil,  
a gentle uprising in green,  
where each seed whispers freedom,  
and daisies declare themselves  
citizens of an unruly nation.
